Grammar

BiGrammar

Blender’s metalanguage for everything syntax related is called BiGrammar, which defines both a parser and a printer at the same time. The techniques underlying this are similar to those described in the paper Invertible Syntax Descriptions: Unifying Parsing and Pretty Printing.

A BiGrammar may be defined in a left recursive fashion, which can be contributed to the use of packrat parsing with support for left-recursion. The work underlying this is described in the papers Packrat Parsing: Simple, Powerful, Lazy, Linear Time and Packrat Parsers Can Support Left Recursion.
